intro: Psychotria cyanopharynx subsp. cyanopharynx, commonly known as the blue-veined psychotria, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking blue-green foliage, which is due to the presence of specific pigments in its leaves. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. This species is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and understory habitats.
